p: Aedes aegypti (L.) and Ae. albopictus (Skuse) (Diptera: Culicidae) are important vectors of arboviral infections, including yellow fever, dengue, Zika, and chikungunya [ 1, 2, 3]. Vietnam is classified as a hyperendemic dengue country, with all four dengue serotypes present throughout the year [ 4]. In the last half century, dengue fever epidemics have increased in frequency, corresponding to a median annual incidence of 232 cases per 100,000 people [ 4]. Furthermore, chikungunya is expected to become a major health threat in Vietnam in the near future [ 4, 5].
